alert.note: Alert for Cimarron; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Texas, southeastern Cimarron, northwestern Hansford and northeastern Sherman Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 914 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Hough to 11 miles west of Guymon to near Goodwell to near Texhoma to 4 miles southeast of Griggs. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Guymon, Goodwell and Texhoma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Oklahoma...and the Panhandle of Texas.
